result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald R Pickens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges during the term of probation.

- Successfully complete a BIP training program, attend every appointment, no tardiness.
- Successfully complete a Parenting class.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- Random Screens.
- No drugs without a valid prescription.
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any treatment.
- Take all prescribed medication.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- Seek/maintain employment.
- No Contact with the victim.
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation.
- No fine.
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-13-15.

timeConds.notes: Release ONLY for attendance in the Batterers Intervention Program

02-05-16/ Judge Michelle Havas
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days (30 days in 15CM80 and 30 days in 15CM1297), Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 


STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Pickens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Amended JOC reflects 02-05-16 Court order imposing  30   days of condition time 
Order is for 60 days; 30 days on 15CM80 and 30 days on CM1297

Defendant Ronald R Pickens not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Order For Commitment For 30 Days, straight time, Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Dometic Violence Court in the House of Correction with no good time credit for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Ronald R Pickens in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished Defendant for non-compliance and ordered Defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.   Court advised Defendant that agent will schedule further review with the court if needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Pickens in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Ronald R Pickens in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 3  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

As to this case and Case# 15CM001297:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS with the following conditions:

- Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days condition in the House of Correction, with release ONLY for attendance in the Batterer's Intervention Program.
- Successfully complete a BIP training program- attend every appointment, no tardiness
- Successfully complete a Parenting class
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random Screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Court ordered 90 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Seek/maintain employment.
- No contact with the victim
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation
- No fine
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-13-2015 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ronald R Pickens in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Ronald R Pickens in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
AS TO COUNT 1:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to Branch 4 in trial, case transferred to Branch 40 for Plea Hearing.   mld

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Ronald D Pickens not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Defendant was not produced.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Discharge Summary Report from Justice Point Received and filed.   mld
-- Due to defendant's in custody status, he has been discharged from Pretrial Supervision.   mld
with TOT to Justice Point Supervision, no firearms, absolute sobriety and no violations of the law.   mld

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Ronald D Pickens not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FILE NOT IN COURT.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  State's Motion to Modify Bail is heard and Granted by the Court.  The Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $500.00 on case 2015CM1297 and $250.00 cash bail on case 2015CM80.  

Defense counsel is awaiting for the 911 tape.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CM1297 and 2015CM80.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.H.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald R Pickens in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Ronald R Pickens in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
